Commit Message: patch 1 from 154439 contributed by matthias fuessel.  adds an entity resolver to the faces config model loader resource to cause downloading of entities during model rendering from xml.

first round of visual/usability improvements:  - added artificial padding in rendered css boxes for margin insets (all boxes) and padding insets (table cells only) to improve visual separation.  this will be improved to have preferences and per-component driven tweaking in the future. - changed the default border color for decoration borders and table cells to lightgray from lightblue/blue - changed the line style of the decorator border to dashed from dotted. - changed the hiddenprovider so it produces a washed out grey instead of bright cyan color for hidden provider text. - changed tooltip so it only shows the tag name and is not shown during drag operations. - changed drag operations (currently canvas-only
column4: not pallette drop) so that a tooltip is displayed when a drop target is moused over that indicates
column5: if possible
column6: the new previous and next siblings as well as the new parent. - changed the outputlabel to widget=true to improve selectability.

fixed something i broke previously.  i had narrowed the listener scope on the jar change listener so that it would ensure that the listener's project was still open.  i thought that would solve a problem where the locater doesn't unregister itself when a project is closed or deleted or closed (still a problem).  this caused a new problem where we were missing events.  instaed i patched jsfappconfigutils so it checks a project's accessibility before accesssing it.  this is a short term fix.

fix for https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=203145.   changes the way the jspmodelprocessor works so that it triggers off of iresource changes rather than istructuredmodel events.  this has the benefit that the istructuredmodel doesn't need to be held open for long periods and can quickly release resources.  lifecyclelistener has been changed to support listening for events on multiple resources so that only one listener is needed for all resources watched by jspmodelprocessors.

column4: static value variables (creates variables of meta-data specified type) and value expression variables that can receive their variable type from the el value result of another attribute on the same tag.  also integrates code from https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=215461 to create a new jsfsymbolfactory to make it easier to do common symbol creation tasks.  the data model context factory has also been refactored into this factory.  added exemplary usage of decorative variable resolvver to the trinidad tag support in the form a decorative dt variable resolver that resolves the same symbols as the runtime trinidad equivalent.  finally
column5: changes to tests to support changes (no new coverage yet).

Commit Message: datacouch-65 - add support for optimistic locking through @version  @version support is built on top of cas values in couchbase. it does not store an actual version number in the document
column4: but rather reuses cas values transparently to handle optimistic locking.  also
column5: write result checking has been added to the template for better control what happens if a write fails. defaults to none
column6: but can be sett to log or exception.

Commit Message: fix usage deflateroutputstream constructor on android  this api is hidden and unbundled apps that attempt to use it on android will not compile. also added a local_sdk_version to the make file to ensure that it can compile against an sdk. all uses of hidden / private apis are now in libcore.java so this should make it easier for us to move forward with building an interface for okhttp to use these apis.  change-id: ie7fc097b84445d55745a94ce048dd46590887d80

httputils.isnetworkavailable检测网络状态方法有误 在networkhelper里新增checknetstate方法判断当前网络状态  在userloginuidactivity界面执行登陆时 要先进行网络状态判断然后再执行loginasynctask任务 因为在doinbackground里弹toast提示，这在子线程是不允许的  customhttpclient的getfromwebbyhttpclient方法必须加上throws exception强制调用者捕获异常 否则出现异常（如ioexception）的时候会导致程序崩溃  在loginasynctask任务里，因为网络异常而导致执行失败这种情况 那么在onpostexecute里就不能用用户名密码错误这种提示了 这个逻辑我没提交修改，给你们提个醒  以上这些问题在userloginactivity和detailsactivity里同样存在  最后再加上两个方便打印的工具类，能够显示打印信息所在类以及行数  最后弱弱的问一句：eoe客户端存在这么多明显的bug， 是作者完成的太匆忙还是其为了让大伙参与到改bug中而有意为之的吗？

version updated to 1.0.1  - update dependency for craftbukkit 1.6.2 r0.1 - fixed a few bugs with nullpointerexceptions occuring when giving books that had no content. - made the onplayerjoin listener a bit more sane  signed-off-by: steven downer <grinch@outlook.com>

update version to 1.0.3-snapshot  - fixed issue with commands not functioning as expect. - added checks if the console is performing commands. - added finalname to pom.xml. - changed all command permissions to lore.command.<command_name>.
1.2.1 update  - fixed issue with command arguments - updated bukkit dependency to r2.1  signed-off-by: steven downer <grinch@outlook.com>
update to 1.3-snapshot  - added configuration option to allow villager trading. set to false by default
column4: if enabled this will allow books that are in lore's library to be traded to villagers. - forced books that are added to lore's library to use the book's title as a name. this results in /lore create [name] to now being simply /lore create. - switched logging of yaml files during the verifybook() method to be a debug-only log. - really removed vault dependency.  signed-off-by: steven downer <grinch@outlook.com>

Commit Message: update to 2.0.1  - fixed issue that caused a player to always receive a book even if they had it already. - allow empty messages for config.yml
column4: if the message is empty then nothing is said to the player. - did some small optimizations  signed-off-by: steven downer <grinch@outlook.com>

Commit Message: update to 2.0.2  - store the list of books and their corresponding itemstacks in a hashmap - fix copy/paste error with villager_message_key related checks  signed-off-by: steven downer <grinch@outlook.com>

update to 2.1.0  - fix issue that caused the join command to not function correctly - added 'lore list' command. - added 'lore.command.list' permission.  signed-off-by: steven downer <grinch@outlook.com>
lore 2.1.1  - fix incorrect permission for list command. - update license plugin version  signed-off-by: steven downer <grinch@outlook.com>
lore 2.1.2  - fix typo in command usage output.  signed-off-by: steven downer <grinch@outlook.com>

update v2.2  changes - [bug] resolved issue where the create command wouldn't fail if the name was already in use. - [bug] resolved issue where permission messages would not always be sent. - [bug] resolved issue that caused playerdropitemevent and   inventoryclickevent to not play nice with the sticky feature. - [feature] added '/lore update [name]' command. - [feature] added '/lore unsign' command. - [improvement] added chat colors to important values in messages. - [improvement] added logging information when default configuration is created. - [improvement] added feedback to the give command. - [improvement] list command now shows books sorted alphabetically. - [improvement] switch to native 'expand' function instead of using apache filter. - [improvement] compile against bukkit 1.7.2-r0.4 (should still function with previous versions). - [improvement] added more detailed comments to default config.yml.  known issues - when cancelling playerdropitemevent (stopping a player dropping the book from their inventory)
column4: the player will no longer see a book in their inventory however it is still there. this is a bukkit quirk.  signed-off-by: steven downer <grinch@outlook.com>

refactored the rtmp codec to decouple from connection. the state is now stored in an rtmp object attached as an attribute to the iosession. this work is in advance of further refactoring of the connection and client objects coming soon.   updated the debugproxyhandler to work with new mina setup. the proxy is now implemented as a filter which is a much more flexible way of doing things.   added chunksize 0x01 rtmp type. in the protocol decoder this now effects the chunk size for the rest of the iosession. the value is stored on the rtmp state object. the red5 server does not currently send chunksize while streaming. we need to work out if it works with flash 7 or its just a flash 8 thing and also what values may be optimal.  deleted some old classes that were not doing anything. some of these will come back as the api is implemented.

Commit Message: added configuration for flvreader's maxbuffersize

merged the code from appserver-8 and some refactoring for flvreader and related code. (1) flvreader now uses a prefetching buffer for file reading and the file won't be mapped to memory at the beginning but read as needed. the prefetching buffer is mainly used for reducing the disk io overhead and the size of buffer can be configured in red5-common.xml as a static property of flvreader "buffersize". (2) cache for flvreader in flv is temporarily disabled by returning null on flvreader.getfiledata(). we need to redesign the cache architecture to put cache logic beneath flvreader so that both tag caching and file caching are feasible.

column4: or at least to make the math return an erased type:  numeric<t>&emptyinterface given t satisfies numeric<t> would allow you do do math
column5: but it would return t from math operations
column6: so you can't do n++ with that type. if you want to be able to do n++ you need numeric<t>&emptyinterface given t satisfies numeric<t> & emptyinterface which the typechecker will simplify to t
column7: which isn't erased. we tried to find another way and concluded you can't do math on erased types anymore
column8: so there's no need to test this.

issue #754: statementtransformer: fix compilation errors for conditionlists and implement conditionlist support for if statements

issue #754: statementtransformer: assign the result var to a default value on else branches. we do this so that the result variable can be declared final and still satisfy java's definite assignment analysis. it needs to be final so it can be captured with the if block (the real one
column4: not the one which just assigns it)

Commit Message: issue #754: statementtransformer: refactor the transformedcondition into an interface (cond) and subclasses for each of the kinds of condition. this allows us to transform a condition into something disassembled enough to put back together in different ways depending on whether we're transforming a if

issue #882: optimize transformed code for statements like 'for (i in lhs..rhs) ...' and 'for (i in (lhs..rhs).by(step)' where the rangeop has type range<integer> or range<character> to a c-style 'for' loop using primitive long or int.  note the use of a compiler annotation (@disableoptimization["rangeopiteration"]) to control whether this optimization is performed. this makes testing the correctness of the optimization *much* easier.
issue #882: support a @requireoptimization["optimizationname"] compiler annotation which produces an error at compile time if the given optimization cannot be applied
column4: including with a reason why it cannot be applied.  this is the counter-part to @disableoptimization["optimizationname"] together we can use these to check that an optimization doesn't change program semantics or to benchmark the difference that a given optimization makes.

Commit Message: issue #929: move the tests out of issuestest: there are a number of cases to test so lets avoid cluttering the issues/ subtree.
partially fix #929 by:  * allowing the 'declaration' of transformations which push an uninitialized   reference onto the operand stack
column4: ( see expressiontransformer.uninitializedoperand(boolean) ) * allowing the 'declaration' transformations which use a backward   branching construct   ( see expressiontransformer.backwardbranch(node) )
column5: * changing the transformed 'new' expression to use a letexpr   when both of these conditions hold (essentially as described by stef in the   discussion on #929)
column6: see callbuilder.evaluateargumentsfirst(boolean) and   it's callers. this handles the cases of a sequenceenumeration (i.e. an   implicit instantiation of arraysequence) and an   explicit instantiation with a spread op (implicit 'for' loop) * changing the transformation of 'super()' invocations when   a backward branch is used in the transformation of the arguments to the   'super()' invocation. in this case we generate static methods to hold   the argument expressions thus the backward branching construct operated in a   method without an uninitialized reference implicitly on the operand stack   (as is the case with the invokespecial of an <init> method). * because we're using static methods to contain the super() invocation's   argument expressions this doesn't work for inner or local classes with a   spread in their superclass initializer invocation. at the moment we   makeerroneous() in such cases. i hope to address this hole at some point.

fix for #1327: compiler does not respect type parameter bounds  boxingvisitor: detect generic method calls where the type arguments are going to be erased down to the  type parameter bounds and mark the node as untrusted type (to be used in applyboxinganderasure) expressiontransformer: when we build the list of type arguments
column4: make sure we find the right bounds to  erase to if required
column5: and apply type arguments properly to the bounds. also refuse to erase to a single bound  if there are more than one since we can't represent that in java.  also in gettypeforparameter do the same sort of calculation so that we pretend the parameter is of the type of  the bound if we know it can't satisfy it in java. abstracttransformer: in makejavatype
column6: replace type arguments with their bounds if the type argument does not  satisfy the java bound or is erased
column7: and generally apply the same logic as expressiontransformer.gettypeargumentlist

column4: set jetty to use the default java classloader implementation instead of the java servlet classloader requirements.  the soa-client/server do funky things with classloaders and in many cases couldn't find specific resources or was loading the wrong classes.   changing the jetty setting for classloaders to give priority to the parent classloader resolves the issue.  this now enables the globalserviceconfig.xml to be visible to all services running in the app server.

turmeric-1657: replace printexceptions with logging of exceptions.  there are many spots where the tests just print stack traces and this clutters up the console.  these should be logged to the runtime log file so they can be tracked and captured there

Commit Message: turmeric-1657: clean up soatests to remove use of system.out.println in tests.  numerous cleanups of system.out.println have been replaced with appropriate logger.debug method calls.  this should greatly reduce the overall noise that these tests produce.  also replaced where possible printstacktrace with logging of the stacktrace instead at debug level.

resources: fix classcastexception on cloning resourcedescriptor  when cloning a resource descriptor that was loaded from persistent storage
column4: the following classcastexception is thrown:  caused by: java.lang.classcastexception: org.hibernate.collection.persistentmap cannot be cast to java.util.hashmap 	at org.opennaas.core.resources.descriptor.resourcedescriptor.clone(resourcedescriptor.java:172) 	at net.i2cat.mantychore.queuemanager.queuemanager.newresourcedescriptor(queuemanager.java:276) 	... 28 more  this is caused by the code assuming that the properties map is allways a hashmap. for a resourcedescriptor loaded from persistent storage this assumption is not true.  the patch replaces the attempt to clone the properties map by a simple copy of the collection to a newly allocated hashmap.

Commit Message: persistence: fix filter for entitymanagerfactory service lookup  generociosgijparepository asks osgi for an entitymanagerfactory service.  such services are offered by dynamic jpa
column4: a bundle that detects persistence.xml files and automatically creates entitymanagerfactory services for each persistence unit. dynamicjpa exposes two entitymanagerfactory services for each persistence unit: the real entitymanagerfactory and a wrapper that hides restarts and changes of the bundle providing the persistence unit. to disinguish the two
column5: dynamicjpa adds the isdynamicfactory property to the service.  genericosgijparepository attempts to filter the service selection using this property
column6: but as the log file shows the filter is not as we expect:   01-19@16:23:00 [blueprint extender: 3]debug org.opennaas.core.persistence.genericosgijparepository - looking up service from registry with properties: (&(objectclass=javax.persistence.entitymanagerfactory)(isdynamicfactory=null)(persistenceunit=resourcecore))  notice the check isdynamicfactory=null when we would have expected isdynamicfactory=true.  the problem is that the properties instance used by genericosgijparepository is used in a type-unsafe manner. the properties class inherits from hashtable
column7: but should only be used for string key and string values. the methods of properties provide type-safety
column8: but the methods inherited from hashtable do not. thus the compiler doesn't complain when attempting to use a boolean as a property value rather than a string. the result is that getproperty returns null later on.  this patch replaces the boolean with a string value and changes the code to call the type-safe setproperty rather than put.

Commit Message: use type-safe api of properties  properties only opertors on string key and string values. the methods inherited from hashtable should be avoided as they are not type-safe.  this patch updates the two createservicefilter methods to use the type safe stringpropertynames() method rather than the keys() method. the stringpropertynames() method also takes chained properties instances into account - something the keys() method doesn't.  the patch changes the use of the legacy enumerator class to the use of a for iteration.  finally the patch updates both methods to avoid the repeated string concatenation in a loop. it does so by using a stringbuilder (this is not strictly related to the rest of the patch
column4: but is generally considered best practice).

Commit Message: use type-safe api of properties.  properties only operates on string key and string values. the methods inherited from hashtable should be avoided as they are not type-safe.  this patch updates createfilter methods in activators to use the type safe setproperty(string
column4: string) method rather than put(string
column5: object) one.  the patch doesn't fix anything and is only for consistency with the rest  of the code (and to guard against future mistakes).  git-svn-id: http://svn.i2cat.net/repos/manticore/trunk@1747 e5892e71-24e5-41bb-b533-28a584b410ba

Commit Message: use type-safe api of properties.  properties only operates on string key and string values. the methods inherited from hashtable should be avoided as they are not type-safe.  this patch replaces the use of properties.put(string
column4: object) method passing a string as value
column5: to use the type safe setproperty(string
column6: string) one.  the patch doesn't fix anything and is only for consistency with the rest  of the code (and to guard against future mistakes).  git-svn-id: http://svn.i2cat.net/repos/manticore/trunk@1755 e5892e71-24e5-41bb-b533-28a584b410ba

Commit Message: added resource references to network descriptor.  this patch makes resource references persistent

Commit Message: remove opennaas unrelated examples from platform.  as stated in issue http://jira.i2cat.net:8080/browse/opennaas-180  opennaas platform contains a folder with irrelevant examples. these examples come from service-mix. they are not related to opennaas and should
column4: be removed.  they are added to platform target when service-mix is unpacked as part of platform building. service-mix is unpacked within a maven-dependency-plugin execution with id unpack-apache-servicemix on package phase.  this patch configures the above mentioned execution for excluding examples folder.

Commit Message: packaging: upgrade to latest release of fuse esb  the patch upgrades opennaas to the latest release of fuse esb. while doing so it attempts to parameterize references to version numbers of fuse components.  this release of fuse changes how features installed through the bootfeatures setting are loaded. this solves some problems in which features that would install normally after startup would fail when installed with other features through the bootfeatures property. however as a consequence features now need to be self-contained. ie it is no longer suffient to refer to cxf and activemq features in bootfeatures; the opennaas features have to depend on those features directly.  to add the necessary dependencies to the opennnaas features i had to switch the features-maven-plugin from org.apache.felix.karaf.tooling to the newer org.apache.karaf.tooling version.  finally
column4: i changed the featuresboot list to be based on the new fuse default
column5: with opennaas features added. this solves the problem of the console service being restarted and a stack traces printed the first time opennaas is started.

Commit Message: fix error with mapping between action name and action implementation in ospf actionset.  this error caused configureospfaction to be called when ospf_get_configuration was requested. it also caused getospfconfigaction to be called when ospf_configure was requested.  mapping has been changed to achieve desired behavior.

build: refactor maven project files  the patch  - moves all version numbers to distributionmanagement and   pluginmanangement sections. this means that a version   number of a plugin or dependency is stored in one place.   for external dependencies the version is moved to the   top level pom file.  - moves the version number of internal dependencies to   distributionmanagement sections. in contrast to the   external dependencies
column4: these version numbers are stored   in the inner most pom that still covers all uses of   the dependency. ie opennaas artifacts are in the top   level pom
column5: manticore artifacts in the manticore pom
column6: and test artifcats in the test pom. this also nicely   ensures that we don't refer to
column7: say
column8: a test artifact   from outside the tests.    the internal dependencies are parameterized to use the   project version number.  - all projects are updated to inherit the version number   from the top level project.  - use the project.version property rather than a   hardcoded value in paths.  - use project.version rather than pom.version (pom.version   is deprecated).  - removes redundant parts of the project files:     - sourceencoding is defined once in the top level      pom and inherited     - redudant or unused <resources> declarations are      removed (the defaults are usually fine - and maven      is a about convention over configuration).     - repeated repository references are removed.     - repeated dependencies and plugins

Commit Message: build: fix pax exam2 dependencies  it is important that tests that run on pax exam2 do not accidentally pull in pax exam 1 components.  pulling the framework in as a dependency is recommended in the karaf test container documentation and it speeds up test execution.

tests: let net.i2cat.nexus.resources.tests use injection  the patch cleans up the net.i2cat.nexus.resources.tests (currently the only tests using the karaftestcontainer) such that dependency injection is used to obtain references to other services.  the patch also removes the polling code and delay to wait for other services. the intention with that code was to give the blueprint containers time to start and thus ensure that repositories and capabilities needed for the tests had been loaded. it is faster and more robust to instead inject the blueprint container reference into the test. this ensures that the test isn't executed until the required blueprint container has finished initilization. the added benefit is to make the dependency explicit in the code.  please note that i do not guarantee that i recognized all dependencies. if you see the tests fail non-deterministically then please tell me so we can add all dependencies.
tests: port net.i2cat.luminis.tests.commandskaraf to pax-exam 2  also uses injection to obtain references to other services and to express dependencies on blueprint containers.
features: fixed coordinates of nexus-test-helper  the uri was incorrectly formatted.

nexus.test.helper: make pax-exam1 optional  the net.i2cat.nexus.test.helper package contains utility classes useful for testing. the package was unusable with pax-exam2 because it required pax-exam1 to be loaded.  this patch makes the pax-exam1 dependency optional. thus remaining classes from the package can be used with pax-exam2. this workaround can be removed once all tests have been transitioned to pax-exam2.

tests: port weeb26 tests to pax exam 2  note that the tests are not actually included in opennaas/manticore (they are commented out of manticore/tests/sprints/pom.xml). i assume this is because the tests are failing.  one of the ported tests still fails (interfacesvlankaraftest). as far as i can see this is because the test is buggy. it fails with:  [error] the command encapsulation is limited in logical tunnels
apply codestyle to mantychore model.  mantychore model was not using our codestyle. hence
column4: modifying any file in the model caused the automatic application of the codestyle
column5: leading to unreadable patches.  this commit applies codestyle in all mantychore model classes
column6: to avoid behavior explained above.

column4: and those services not being populated by routingoptionsparser

Commit Message: bug fixes in ospf actionset for junos.  - velocity templates receive enabledstate as a string and compares it with enabledstate.tostring() in the model. - some templates have been updated to achieve desired behaviour. - old unused templates have been removed.  - configureospfstatusaction was not changing the configuration due to using getconfiguration command instead of editconfigutarion one. this has been fixed. - parser failed when a disable tag was found in ospf. method signature has been changed in order for digester to find the method.
fixes in tests to match changes in templates.
bugfix in protocolsparser not creating empty ospfservice.  protocolsparser was not creating an ospfservice when no ospfareas were configured.

column5: this patch adds an @ignore annotation to the failing test.

Commit Message: tests: relocate net.i2cat.nexus.tests.helper  this module doesn't contain tests
column4: it contains utility classes used by tests. placing the module on the tests module makes it difficult to move common dependencies for tests into the parent poms. if we did then the helper module would be affected too even though it isn't a test. eg we don't want the helper to be subject to pax exam execution.  this patch therefore moves this module to the manticore/bundles module. the patch also deletes the now unused intrationtestshelper class.  the patch will make future patches for cleaning up the poms of test modules simpler.

Commit Message: tests: clean up pom files of test projects  during the transition to pax exam 2 all test projects accumulated workarounds for exluding pax exam 1. now that all tests are ported there workaround can be removed
column4: simplifying the project files.  this patch gets rid of pax exam 1 dependencies
column5: restores the parent directory as the parent project
column6: and moves test environment (pax exam 2) dependencies to the parent pom.

Commit Message: wonesys: fix race condition in commandresponselistener  the wonesys protocol implementation uses a transport abstraction for communication with the device or with a mock transport. in either case a commandresponselistener is registerd as an osgi service for receiving the reply as events from the transport.  the commandresponselistener is however not threads safe: if the reply is generated before wonesysprotocolsession calls wait
column4: wait will block until timing out. java's notify/wait mechanism doesn't "remember" a notify call.  this patch resolves the issue by using a countdownlatch to signal the response. the patch also removes some of the cruft from the implementation
column5: simplifying both commandresponselistener and the class using it.  finally
column6: the patch ensures that the commandresponselistener is unregistered after use. otherwise instances will accumulate for every command sent to the device.  testing done: unit and integration tests pass. i did not run against a physical device.

column5: an iterator over hashtable may not be interleaved with modifications to the hash table. the solution is thus to synchronize all access to the hash table.  the patch fixes the problem and also cleans up the code a bit:  - uses hashmap rather than the legacy hashtable class.  - adds @override annotations.  - removes some unnecessary collection allocations.  - simplifies a number of loops over collections.  - prevents exposing internal data structures.  - avoid breaking encapsulating caused by casting interfaces   to implementations.  testing done: unit and integration tests pass.

Commit Message: use netconf edit message with no_change mode when deleting ospf parts of the configuration.  as stated in junos netconf xml management protocol guide
column4: no_change mode should be used when trying to delete elements form the configuration.  this patch applies this behaviour and updates velocity templates accordingly. it also remove ignored operation specifications. this patch is responsible of configureospfstatusaction being able to actually add or delete <disable> tag.

Commit Message: tests: port ospf and gre tunnel tests to pax exam 2  i also updated tests to not catch all failure exceptions explicitly. junit will by default consider them test failures and log a stack trace.

build: revert accidental change of parent in bod integration test  in the previous commit i accidentally changed the parent of one of the existing integration tests projects. this patch reverts the change.
tests: simplify opsf and gretunnel test projects  the patch updates the two new integration test projects to follow the simpler maven project structure made possible by a pure pax exam 2 setup.

build: configure site module  in maven 3 the site module needs to be configured to allow for reporting plugins to work. this patch configures the site plugin.  the patch also configures various reports
column4: including javadoc
column5: source code cross reference
column6: find bugs analysis
column7: pmd and cpd analysis.  i disabled a couple of slow reports
column8: and generally chose aggregated reports over individual reports.  i had to update the two platform projects to ensure that the features-magen-plugin is executed in the correct phase (otherwise it would conflict with the javadoc plugin).  the site report can be build by running:      mvn clean install site  followed by      mvn site:stage  the latter combines all reports into a single report structure in target/staging/  note that producing the reports will take a lot of memory and the default maven settings will not suffice. i set      maven_opts="-xmx2048m -xx:maxpermsize=1024m"  to solve this.

Commit Message: build: sync lists of feature repositories  we refer to service mix feature repositories in three different places:  - our own feature repositories - the features-maven-plugin - the karaf feature configuration file  unfortunately this repetition cannot be completely avoided (even though it breaks dry).  this patch syncs the lists of feature repositories
column4: ensuring that the features we resolve at runtime are the same as the features resolved by the maven plugin. specifically this ensures that all the bundles needed at runtime have been installed in the karaf system repository during build time.  as a consequence no extra bundles will be downloaded the first time mantychore is started. thus mantychore can now be started without a network connection. even more important
column5: mantychore integration tests can be executed without a network connection. the integration tests also finish significantly faster as all dependencies are present in the test environment.  note that i changed the configuration of the features-maven-plugin to install dependencies too. by itself this change is however not enough because the various feature repositories shipped with servicemix have overlapping feature descriptors with inconsistent dependencies. thus before this patch the cxf repository resolved at build time was different than the one resolved at runtime.

Commit Message: build: refactor feature repositories  the osgi feature repositories of opennaas and mantychore had several problems:  - they were not self-contained in the sense that installing   the feature required one to manually ensure that   requirements had been installed before.  - they were split into a deps feature and a core feature. the   deps feature was really a usable feature in itself; it simply   embodied dependencies. the core feature on the other hand   contained all features of the product. this didn't allow   for selectively installing features of the product.  - dependencies were not flagged as dependencies.  - bundle version numbers were hardcoded.  - some of the depenendencies are unnecessary (like activemq)
column4: and others are only used by periferal functionality (like   cxf). forcing these dependencies are pre-requisites means   that integration testing becomes unnecessarily slow as   all dependencies have to be started for every test.  this patch refactors the feature repositories.  - there are no longer any -deps features. features are now   self-contained with all dependencies specified. this means   one can do 'feature:install x' and expect it to install all   prerequisites.  - features are split according to what one can consider   "end-user features"
column5: eg router
column6: network and bod are features
column7: and so is junos. the core opennaas functionality is a feature   too.  - all version numbers are parameterized.  - i tried to identify the essential dependencies of each feature.  testing done: unit and integration tests pass. i manually installed each feature on a fresh build to verify that they can resolve all bundle dependencies. i ran mantychore and configured it to connect to an olive. i verified that basic commands like creating logical routers and subintefaces work.

Commit Message: created addinterfacetolraction.  this action follows steps below to move a sub-interface configuration tree from the physical router to a specified logical one. 1) get sub-interface configuration (reading from candidate). 2) filter received response to get only the tree we are interested in. 3) copy filtered tree to logical router configuration. 4) delete sub-interface configuration from the physical router.  templates for reading the interface (getinterface.vm) and copying an xml (mergerawxml.vm) have been created. deletion is performed re-using deletesubinterface.vm template
column4: which has been updated to read $elementname from an extra param.  this latter change required updating deletesubinterfaceaction to pass logical router name in an extraparam. this makes it much readable also.  class has been tested to check generated rpc messages are correct.

Commit Message: build: rename features to opennaas naming scheme  the patch adjusts the feature names to avoid the name 'mantychore'. all feature names are prefixed opennaas- (with a couple of exceptions for test bundles).  i am not using the proposed opennaas-extensions- prefix for feature names as it would make the names unusually long compared to other servicemix feature names. prefixing with opennaas- should be enough to make the names fairly unique.  i renamed mantychore-base to mantychore-cim as the feature is about representing the cim model. in its current form the feature also holds the network model
column4: but this is because the dependency between the two is upside down. once the dependency has been inverted the network model bundle should be moved to the network feature. similarly the queuemanager bundle should be part of opennaas-core
column5: but the bundle needs to be renamed and moved first.  the opennaas-luminis feature should possibly be split and renamed
column6: but for now i have put those bundles into a single feature.

Commit Message: tests: make required features of each test explicit  until now all integration tests simply relied on mantychore by default loading all modules. this leads to unnecessarily slow tests as they load bundles not related to the test.  this patch changes the integration tests to explicitly specify which features they test. other features are not loaded.  this has a significant impact on runtime and also means we can adjust the default feature set independently of the integration tests (eg remove some non-essential features or maybe add features that would have slowed down integrations tests significantly).  the patch also adds instructions to prevent the shell component of karaf from being loaded.

build: refactor feature repositories  the osgi feature repositories of opennaas and mantychore had several problems:  - they were not self-contained in the sense that installing   the feature required one to manually ensure that   requirements had been installed before.  - they were split into a deps feature and a core feature. the   deps feature was really a usable feature in itself; it simply   embodied dependencies. the core feature on the other hand   contained all features of the product. this didn't allow   for selectively installing features of the product.  - dependencies were not flagged as dependencies.  - bundle version numbers were hardcoded.  - some of the depenendencies are unnecessary (like activemq)
column4: and others are only used by periferal functionality (like   cxf). forcing these dependencies are pre-requisites means   that integration testing becomes unnecessarily slow as   all dependencies have to be started for every test.  this patch refactors the feature repositories.  - there are no longer any -deps features. features are now   self-contained with all dependencies specified. this means   one can do 'feature:install x' and expect it to install all   prerequisites.  - features are split according to what one can consider   "end-user features"

Commit Message: resource
column4: persistence: make resourcedescriptorrepository closeable  resourcedescriptorrepository (or rather its base class genericosgijparepository) creates entitymanager instances from an entitymanagerfactory. unfortunately these entitymanagers are never closed
column5: leading to resources leaks and persistence problems when the bundle is stopped.  this patch makes two changes:  - it adds a close method to genericosgijparepository to give it a chance   to close the entitymanager.  - it changes resourcerepository such that the resourcedescriptorrepository   is injected rather than created internally.  the latter change allows the blueprint container to manager the lifecycle of the resourcedescriptorrepository (and thus call close).  i considered to add a close method to resourcerepository instead
column6: however resourcerepository already allows the dependency to be injected (it can operate with either an injected genericrepository or an internally created resourcedescriptorrepository). thus one would have to track whether the repository is created internally or injected and only close it when created internally. i concluded that this is too messy and it would be cleaner to always inject the dependency. that this is the correct solution is also demonstrated by unit tests currently having to set an unused persistence unit when calling the constructor. in the refactored code this is no longer necessary.

Commit Message: resources: shutdown hsqldb automatically  hsqldb needs to be shutdown before terminating the application. otherwise unwritten (but otherwise committed) changes will not be written to disk. since the delayed write interval is configured to 10 seconds
column4: this is quite likely to result in dataloss when resources are modified just prior to shutting down opennaas.  the normal way to shutdown hsqldb is to execute the "shutdown" sql command. this does however bind the application code to hsqldb and i find this undesirable for the production code. the alternative way is to set the shutdown=true property. this triggers an automatic shutdown when the last connection is closed.  unfortunately this change by itself is not enough to cause hsqldb to shut down. this is because the dynamic jpa bundle never closes its entitymanagerfactory and thus the last reference to hsqldb is never closed.  this patch adds the shutdown=true for the production persistence unit; the test persistence unit is not modified.

Commit Message: jpa: replace dynamic jpa with aries jpa  dynamic jpa contains a bug in which it never closes the entitymanagerfactory instances it creates. this is a particular problem with hsqldb which relies on the entitymanagerfactory being closed to trigger a shutdown of the embedded database.  it also seems the dynamic jpa is no longer maintained
column4: making it a bad choice. finally
column5: dynamic jpa doesn't respect the osgi enterprise specification (which is possibly why the bundle is no longer maintained).  opennaas already depends on apache aries and aries happens to have jpa support. this patch therefore replacces dynamic jpa with apache aries jpa.  a number of changes had to be made to the hibernate packaging: the hibernate package now exports a persistenceprovider service which allows it to be picked up by aries (this follows the osgi enterprise spec). i had to remove the packaging of javax.persistence to avoid conflicts. i also replaced the fixed import of org.hsqldb with a dynamic import to allow alternative jdbc drivers to be used (eg move the database to postgresql for a more robust database backend).  an extra metadata header had to be added to the resources bundle to allow persistence.xml to be picked up.  finally
column6: the jpa feature needs to be added as a boot feature. the same change needs to be done to mantychore and other tools building on opennaas.

tests: use options helper for test configuration  all integration tests repeat more or less the same pax exam configuration. this is a clear violation of dry.  this patch introduces opennaasexamoptions. it contains static methods for generating configuration fragments used by many tests.  the patch also introduces the abstractkarafcommandtest base class for those tests that primarily test karaf commands.

Commit Message: added integration tests for add/remove interface from lr actions.  just added a call to them in the chassis capability integration test calling all chassis actions. this patch also enables this test. failing action (set encapsulation) has been moved to another test
column4: which remains ignored.  asserts have been changed to produce more descriptive errors.

Commit Message: persistence: replace hibernate with openjpa  hibernate is known to be difficult to use in an osgi context
column4: partly because it isn't packaged as a bundle and thus requires repackaging.  this patch replaces hibernate with openjpa in opennaas. openjpa is available as a bundle and thus doesn't require repackaging.  several opennaas classes made explicit use of the hibernate api. this patch changes those classes to use the jpa api when possible. in one case the openjpa api needs to be used directly: opennaas's dao interface makes use of query by example and this functionality is not available in jpa 2.  access to the jdbc driver is always challenging in an osgi context. previously we added a dynamic-import to our repackaged hibernate bundle. this allowed it to load the jdbc driver. the aries jpa recommended approach is however to configure the persistence.xml file to lookup a data source through jndi. using this mechanism
column5: the jdbc driver is loaded by our opennaas-core-resources bundle
column6: which publishes the data source as an osgi service. thus no dynamic import is required. this also has the benefit that it becomes easier to inject configuration values when setting up the data source (should we wish to do so in the future).

Commit Message: merge branch 'develop' of git://github.com/dana-i2cat/opennaas into feature/addinterfacetolr-moves-all-interface-config  conflicts: 	manticore/tests/integration/net.i2cat.mantychore.tests.capability/src/test/java/net/i2cat/mantychore/chassiscapability/test/chassiscapabilityintegrationtest.java 	manticore/tests/sprints/sprint0_2/src/test/java/mantychore/configurelrtest.java  conflicts resolved. all tests pass.
added script to test add/remove interface to logical router.  two other scripts have been updated

Commit Message: resources: fix partial remove of active resources  the following steps lead to inconsistent state:  1) create resource 2) start resource 3) remove resource (it launches an error
column4: as expected) 4) stop resource 5) remove resource -> error.  the expected behaviour in 5) is that the resource can be removed.  the problem is caused by opennaas removing the database entry for the resource before checking whether the resource is active. this means the resource is partially removed in step 3 even though it is active. step 5 fails because the resource cannot be removed from the database as it was already deleted once.  ideally the complete remove operation would be a single database transaction
column5: but implementing this would require quite a number of changes to how we deal with persistence.  instead this patch simply reorders the code:  1) check that resource is inactive 2) remove from internal data structures 3) remove from database

scripts: workaround for nosuchelementexception in karaf  the patch addresses issue opennaas-162. the problem is that karaf throws a nosuchelementexception when entering an empty command while the karaf history is empty (ie on first run until a command has been exexcuted).  the bug is fixed in newer releases of karaf

Commit Message: platform: merged manticore/platform into platform  we used to have both an opennaas platform project without extensions and a mantychore platform project including extensions.  this patch merges these such that we only got one platform project. this also means that the feature repositories get merged and we only need one assembly project.  i added all artifacts as dependencies in the platform project. this is to ensure that maven builds the artficats in the correct order. as a consequence i had to move the dependencymanagement section of manticore/pom.xml to pom.xml.

build: refactor platform assembly  the packaging step was split into two maven projects earlier: the platform and the assembly. this patch refactors this into a single maven project.  we now rely more on the assembly plugin and less on the dependency and resource plugins to drive the assembly. i find this makes it a bit easier to understand what is going on.  the resulting artifacts are now stored in platform/target/.  note that the actual project version number is now used to name the packages.

build: rename all group ids to org.opennaas  the point of a group id is to identify the team that created the maven project. there is no point in making a separate group id for each artifact.  this patch renames the group id of all our projects to org.opennaas.
renamed extensions bundle folders  stripped group id prefixes and unified the name scheme used.

renamed extensions artifacts  they now follow the naming convention (ie org.opennaas+path elements). the exception to the rule is that the bundles folder name is not included in the artifact id as i expect that folder to be deleted.  java package named are unaltered. those will be renamed later.  defaults for bundle symbolic name are now defined in the top level pom and should not be repeated in subprojects.
build: fix package export declaration  otherwise we run into problems when renaming packages later.

extensions: refactor java package names  extension packages now follow the proposed naming scheme.  there are two exceptions: the junos and wonesys packages are slightly different from the artifact ids. i suggest the artifact ids are adjusted to match the package names rather than the other way around.  the change was produced by the following script:      #!/bin/sh      find_package_root() {         find $1/src/main/java/ -type d \( ! -links 3 -or -exec sh -c "find {} -maxdepth 1 -type f | grep -q ''" \; \)  -print -quit     }      package2path() {         echo $1 | sed -e 's:\.:/:g'     }      path2package() {         echo $1 | sed -e "s:.*/src/.*/java/::" -e "s:/:.:g"     }      move() {         if [ -d $1 ]; then             mkdir -p $2             git mv $1/* $2/         fi     }      replace_package() {         find * -type f -exec sed -i -e "/artifactid/ n" -e "s:$1\([;.*]\):$2\1:g" {} \;     }      # the script can run in two modes:     #     # - either a base directory and a package prefix is provided as     #   arguments. in this case the script will proposed a rename map.     #     # - or the script can read a rename map from stdin and perform the     #   renaming.     #      if [ $# -eq 2 ]; then         base=$1         prefix=$2          for dir in $base/*; do             if [ -d $dir ]; then                 old=$(path2package $(find_package_root $dir))                 new=$prefix.$(basename $dir)                 echo $dir $old $new             fi         done | sort -r --key=2
column4: 2 | column -t     else         while read dir oldp newp; do             old=$(package2path $oldp)             new=$(package2path $newp)              move $dir/src/main/java/$old/ $dir/src/main/java/$new             move $dir/src/test/java/$old/ $dir/src/test/java/$new              replace_package $oldp $newp              echo "$oldp -> $newp"         done     fi  i used the Commit Message: update resourcerepository to create and destroy sessions when resource is created/removed.  resourcerepository is responsible of synchronizing resource lifecycle with protocolsessionmanager one. - it creates a protocolsessionmanager for the resource when the resource is created. - it destroys the protocolsessionmanager for a resource
column4: when the resourceis removed. - it also creates one session per registered context when a resource is started
column5: if it does not already exists.  (this assures a single session per each registered context is available after a starting the resource.) - it also destroys all sessions of a resource when the resource is stopped.  (this assures no session is available after stopping the resource.)  this patch adds session creation/deletion when resource is started/stopped.  it also fixes a bug when rolling back from deactivateresource. the bug caused bootstrapper and capabilities to be reseted even if deactivate failed
column6: producing an unusable resource. patched code makes this reset only when deactivate is succesfull.

Commit Message: add test to check protocolsessionmanager and resource lifecycle is the same.  resourcerepository is responsible of synchronizing resource lifecycle with protocolsessionmanager one. - it creates a protocolsessionmanager for the resource when the resource is created. - it destroys the protocolsessionmanager for a resource
column4: when the resourceis removed. - it also creates one session per registered context when a resource is started
column5: if it does not already exists.  (this assures a single session per each registered context is available after a starting the resource.) - it also destroys all sessions of a resource when the resource is stopped.  (this assures no session is available after stopping the resource.)  this patch creates a test to check behaviour explained above is followed.

autobahn: add first revision of autobahn driver  this patch adds support for requesting and shutting down connections via the autobahn bod.  this initial version hardcodes most connection parameters due to lack of support for such parameters in opennaas (bandwidth
column4: vlan id
column5: lifetime
column6: etc). once opennaas bod support has been extended
column7: the driver can be extended too. consider this driver a use case to drive the opennaas bod support forward.  the initial version lacks support for queue transactions. this is because the autobahn webservice is stateless and does not support explicit transaction demarcation. poor man's transaction support without isolation could be achieved by rolling back the creation/release manually (by releasing or recreating)
column8: although there is no guarantee that a released resource can be rereserved (it may have been taken by other reservations). implementing this is not straightforward as opennaas lacks support for a queue context or some other way of maintaining state accross actions that are part of the same queue execution. once such support is added the poor man's transaction support can be implemented.  the autobahn driver requires access to both the user access point and adminstration webservice interfaces of autobahn. these are by default published on the same port
column9: so the protocol context uri is simply the base uri for both services. eg:  protocols:context bod:autobahn autobahn http://autobahn.example.org:8080/autobahn/  the driver will internally append "uap" or "adminstration" to this uri.  access to the administrative interface is required as it is otherwise not possible to query the list of existing reservations.  note that opennaas provides no user interface for inspecting the model of the bod resource. you either have to know the network interfaces of autobahn (by using the autobahn gui) or you have to inspect the opennaas log files.  note that the autobahn reservation process is asynchronous. when opennaas executes the request action
column10: the driver only submits a reservation request. setting up the reservation can possible take minutes (in multidomain setups). therefore the driver will create a link in the resource's model for any reservation not in a finished state. autobahn does allow a callback to be registered
column11: but this requires that opennaas implements a particular webservice and that there is connectivity from autobahn to opennaas (no firewall). in either case
column12: opennaas doesn't know about such asynchronous changes
column13: so even if we implemented the callback interface
column14: we wouldn't be able to react to reservation changes outside the execution of a queue.  as mentioned above
column15: a reservation is represented as a link in the model. it is set on the source's linkedto field. note that autobahn supports creating multiple reservations between the same two ports (interfaces): each reservation can use a different vlan id. since an interface in opennaas only has one linkedto field
column16: such reservations cannot be represented in opennaas.  note that the nsi protocol treats interfaces differently: nsi uses the concept of a network service endpoint
column17: and such an endpoint incorporates the vlan. ie vlan isn't a property in nsi. instead
column18: if you have two interfaces a and b
column20: then you have service endpoints a-1000
column25: b-1002 (or whatever naming scheme the nsa chooses to implement). in that case you can indeed only have one connection between two endpoints (which would be interfaces in opennaas). the problem here is that often one cannot connect all endpoints
column26: eg a-1000 and b-1001 are not connectable (depends on the hardware
column27: of course). my point is that bod systems are sufficiently different from each other that it may become difficult to make a common abstraction in opennaas (or that it will require extensive configuration info to map between opennaas' representation and the representation in the bod system - something that would be a pain to maintain).  authentication in autobahn is disabled by default and it not supported by the initial revision of this driver.  integration tests are missing. these will be added soon.

Commit Message: bod: add vlan id

column5: and capacity parameters  the patch extends the opennaas bod subsystem with features required to make it useable with autobahn.  the autobahn driver is updated to use the new features.  i added the joda time library as a dependency.

Commit Message: bod: add cli support for listing interfaces and links  the patch adds the l2bod:interfaces and l2bod:links commands to list the interfaces and links registered in the model of a bod resource.

autobahn: added response items to actionresponses  action responses can contain a list of response objects. these document the actions performed on behalf of the action and their result. this is convenient now that the bulk of the processing happens in the confirmaction and the restoreaction.  it is also convenient to use this to report on discovered ports in gettopologyaction.  this patch refactors the transaction code of the autobahn driver to generate response objects.  unfortunately the opennaas queuemanager execute output only contains this information in case of failures. in case of success the queuemanager replaces the actionresponse with an empty one.

bod: usability improvements in listing of links and interfaces  the network model used for bod resources doesn't capture all properties of the autobahn bod driver. this patch adds some of this information to the output of l2bod:interfaces and l2bod:links
column4: but without adding autobahn specific properties to the generic model.

check ethernet-tagging encapsulation only in ethernet interfaces.  there is a check preventing the creation of subinterfaces with unit different than 0 when no ethernet-tagging is specified in the physical interface.  this check was introduced when solving issue: http://jira.i2cat.net:8080/browse/opennaas-338  in pull request https://github.com/dana-i2cat/opennaas/pull/278  more precisely on commits: 8911c1bf0d8f2c2fcf3597b88cbba3d190b81a6f 6b502d7e63df5a725de1b28e8a9d89234817af3f  some interfaces may have subinterfaces without requiring ethernet-tagging. it is the case of logical interfaces
column4: such as the ones used in gre tunnels.  this patch changes the check to be performed only in ethernet interfaces. this patch allows the following command to work: chassis:createsubinterface router:name gr-1/2/0.1

support creation of loopback interfaces.  a loopback interface can now be created
column4: with unit different than 0. however
column5: there is a limitation and no more than one loopback interface can be configured per router. this prevents also opennaas to create loopback interfaces for logical routers.  limitation: junos configuration can not be committed when a router has more than one unit in a loopback interface. http://www.sadikhov.com/forum/index.php?/topic/179436-how-to-add-multiple-loopback-ip-in-one-logical-router/  trying so will launch following error: "multiple loopback interfaces not permitted in master routing instance"  hence
column6: loopback interfaces cannot be configured if there is already one in the router. furthermore
column7: loopback interfaces cannot be added to logicalrouter the same way other interfaces. that is following steps below: 1) configuring interfaces in the physical router (and commit) 2) moving interfaces into logical-system hierarchy (and commit) as step 1 will fail when committing.

Commit Message: make spring security securitycontext available to the application.      the filter chain now registered doesn't clear securitycontext to make it available to cxf and to the following service invocation.      the problem we faced comes from dosgi not linking registered filter chain with cxf request processing
column4: as explained here:     https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/dosgi-183     instead
column5: filter chain is executed before cxf request processing
column6: which normally cleares the context
column7: thus preventing it being accessible when method invocation is triggered.      to solve this issue
column8: a customised version of org.springframework.security.web.context.securitycontextpersistencefilter is used     securitycontextpersistencefilterskipclearcontext     which lets the user specify if context clearing should be skipped.     using it with "skipclearcontext" property set to true ensures that securitycontext will be available in our environment
column9: while dosgi-183 is not fixed.      dependencies order has been changed to force servlet api version 2.5 is resolved in compilation.  this patch also changes required roles in url filters. the only role required to call all web services is now role_user.

avoid jetty logging in karaf shell.  there is an issue with jetty server logging in karaf: from https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/karaf-1117  to avoid it following workarround can be applied: define following property in system.properties file: workaround for karaf-1117: jetty will use a jul logger. org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.class=org.eclipse.jetty.util.log.javautillog  this workaround should be removed when using jetty 7.6.3 or above
column4: as it will include a proper fix.  this patch applies this workarround in opennaas platform. to do it
column5: a copy of karaf-2.2.2-fuse-04-06 system.properties has been added to platform /etc
column6: and the workarround has been aplied to it.  important notice: any karaf upgrade made in the future should take into account that this system.proeprties file may become out of date. being that the case
column7: it should be replaced by the new one and the workarround applied again.

add sockets to gim.  sockets are required in order to manage connections between different elements in the gim model. there are two kind of power sockets: power sources and power receptors. power sources deliver power
column4: while power receptors receive it. a power receptor can be attached to a single power source.  a powersupply has several power sources. a powerdelivery has several power receptors and several power sources. a powerconsumer may have several power receptors.  in a typical scenario powersupplies sources supply powerdelivery receptors
column5: and and powerdelivery sources supply powerconsumers receptors. however
column6: the model also accepts powersupplies sources directly supplying powerconsumers receptors
column7: although new controllers should be typed to manage such relations.  this patch also introduces new constrollers. apcdrivertest has been updated to check whole workflow works fine from a routerwithpdupowercontroller.

increase injection timeout in itests (set to 20 seconds)  this fix sets timeout to 20 seconds (2 times de default value) in blueprint container injections. it is an intent to reduce the false-negatives test failures we had failing with: gave up waiting for service org.osgi.service.blueprint.container.blueprintcontainer  explanation about the timeout: for other types [different than bundlecontext]
column4: the pax exam injector tries to look up a service of the given type in the osgi service registry. the lookup blocks while there is no matching service and fails the test if no service is found after a configurable timeout. [since pax-exam 2.3.0] the @filter annotation has an optional timeout argument
column5: specifying the lookup timeout in milliseconds. https://ops4j1.jira.com/wiki/display/paxexam/dependency+injection  itests now last arround 25 minutes to complete.

ai 144136: make calendar widget correctly launch calendar app instead of creating a second task stack.   fixes the following issues:   - calendar widget and calendar icon always launch to a specific calendar view--the view last selected by user.   - launching from both widget and app icon clears any existing activity stacks.   - we correctly keeps the stack history when switching between activities using long-press-home-hardkey   bug=1752489  automated import of cl 144136

calendar attendees and reminder fixes  - b/2027729 fixed the crash that happens when you change orientation while scrolling in agenda view - b/2038978 fixed the crash where all the attendees were previous removed by an error - b/2033853 fixed the problem where reminders weren't being saved. - b/2027740 improved logic on when to allow the user to supply a response to an event. it is still not perfect as we are wait for more - b/2024425 allow the user to delete the event even if they didn't create the event - b/2030453 hide delete button when creating new events - fixed the crash that happens when you click on revert while creating new events (only happens when you have an empty calendar) - improved performance by writing the attendees to the content provider iif they have changed. - fixed the title bar to correctly say "view event" or "view meeting invitation" depending on the event. - fixed the problem where existing attendees weren't shown during edit event. info from the server team. - added rect info in the intent show_or_create_contact. can't test yet as my phone has contact sync problems.
fixed the crash that happens when you change orientation while scrolling in agenda view

b/2431102 added check on save to ensure a valid calendar was selected.  editevent performs a background query to get the list of calendars available before setting a default calendar. this made it possible to hit done on an event before any calendars could be set. added a check to ensure a valid calendar has been selected before a save operation is performed on an event.

column4: causing a concurrentmodificationexception. changed the loop to use an explicit iterator and do removals through that iterator.

Commit Message: don't update the mini-month until the day or week transition finishes  previously we would send an event to the controller (to update the mini-month) as soon as we recognized the fling gesture.  now
column4: we delay it until after the viewswitcher animation finishes
column5: to avoid a stutter at the moment you lift your finger.  this also fixes an unreported bug where the mini-month wouldn't get updated at all if you dragged left or right and then lifted your finger without moving.  (in that case we'd animate to the next or previous week
column6: but the mini-month would stay put.)  that's fixed because we now send the controller event from switchviews() rather than from dofling().  bug: 3138116 change-id: ib3ea9a9b356d802338dc9b33622a0a8dfcdad28b

column6: though
column7: we still need to reset mviewstartx to make sure we don't get left in a partially-scrolled state.  tested: both week and day views.  originally i could reproduce the bug very easily

modify the way how to determine sunday/saturday  - utils#issaturday()

b/3293809 adds basic support for accessibility in calendar  this adds accessibility events for navigating the views in calendar. -moving times in day/week view says the time and any overlapping events. -switching between events in the same time slot says the event. -opening an event popup reads the event. -opening edit event reads the event. -opening an event in search reads the event.  fixed a bug in month view that caused a crash.  change-id: i734b43597fbdf76cbf693374ac8585645fab94fe

b/3354202 fixes delete future events bug  delete future events was deleting all events in a series because the code was checking if it was the first event and if so deleting everything. we were passing in the instanced event instead of the original event

b/3431141 fixed the problem where secondary alerts are quiet  this affects all events with multiple alerts. only the first one makes a sound. the ones after that fire silently without vibration.  change-id: i10b1cb56fbd5aafd0cbdaea8c3009c50583c2046
merge "b/3431141 fixed the problem where secondary alerts are quiet"
fix settings toggle not updating  change-id: i18cd499740d9104edf28c61a5970d126463eb111

make dayview not jump on events that cross midnight  there was a bug that would cause dayview to jump to an earlier time when tapping on an event that crossed midnight.  change-id: i3e9d743de036c851803c690bf8c45556ee52aff2
fix crash in portrait with more than 4/day allday events  change-id: i66faf75f2e82ca84cd9d6c7cce4a1a476711f702
fixed the problem where tapping to stop a fling actually opens an event  change-id: ied99e6fc1648b0aff121a25733f8b158dc7b1bd6

b/3459404 fix format of minimonth view in other languages  change-id: i352c9770f0b4da8dbd91c53e2b95770d20ea57cb

make column sorting for allday events handle 24h events  the column sorting code assumed allday events could be sorted by start and end millis. with 24 hour events being drawn as allday events this was no longer a true assumption. this adds code for sorting these events correctly along with allday events.  change-id: i254f495e92e6422bdb7b9ba62e2db17c8057088b
merge "b/3459404 fix format of minimonth view in other languages"

b/3157682 makes the allday area expandable  if there are too many allday events they become impossible to read. this makes it so that in this case we will instead hide the excess events with information about how many are hidden and an easy way to expand the allday area to show all the allday events. also fixes b/3472230  change-id: i5a73cc20f1edde54d90fc76fb7ac5ebd1260b073
b/3418975 fix alert intent so it launches event  change-id: i397c25f20769e6aabcbac9844a92a2083517f913

b/3481389 makes sure menu has correct string  show/hide controls could have the wrong string in some cases. this ensures it always displays the correct one.  change-id: ic7ca363d5a6f7509c77f9d8ee3774783c0edbd29
merge "b/3481389 makes sure menu has correct string"

b/3478177 fixed the problem of overlapped day/week views.  - terminate animations properly. cancel() can leave the viewswitcher in an inconsistent state. - terminate animations as soon as we are within 1 pixel of the end  change-id: i5b0467b821bd5dc3abfd36854e2360939e5b3cec
merge "b/3478177 fixed the problem of overlapped day/week views."

b/3497123 fix sorting of non-allday events  moving 24+h events to allday caused more issues. this queries non-allday and allday events separately so they all end up in their respective correct ordering.  change-id: i2028346969f38cf72587f6e80fc7e8f005819fc3

b/3465101 b/3440829 fix widget loading issues  makes the widget load asyncronously so it doesn't anr and limits the reload rate to twice a second so it doesn't flash a lot.  change-id: i7a8dd9bcec4a9178e9ae898fa2ef21fa21d33a49
b/3454104 fixed illegalstateexception: fragment not added  added logging to track down b/3362680  change-id: ibc0ae119d13623c1b2ff896e93dcd83a8decdb79
merge "b/3454104 fixed illegalstateexception: fragment not added"

b/3385145 use current time for new events in monthview  this adds a fix so that if the user taps today and ends up in the current month (doesn't stop the scroll prematurely) and then taps the new event button the app will use the current time instead of the default time for that month. also adds a fix so tapping the create event button will always create an event on the half hour.  change-id: i709df6dbab4d216884f755c8703a325ae30cfa91
merge "b/3465101 b/3440829 fix widget loading issues"
fix fling problems where the dayview can end up mis-drawn. also split the fling horizontal vs vertical at 50/50. previously
column4: it favors vertical scrolls.  change-id: i81cb267bd70e36069b25d408bcb005133c60fda3

improve linkification of location field  the "location" field of a calendar event is expected to hold a location
column4: but sometimes holds a phone number.  the framework's linkify code looks at "1600 amphitheatre parkway
column5: 94043" and decides that "94043" is a phone number
column6: which isn't great.  as part of bug 3328309
column7: linkification of phone numbers was disabled for the location field.  we now let linkify look for non-phone-number items
column8: and then use the fancy libphonenumber routines in a second pass for more reliable phone number detection.  if we find what looks like a phone number inside a url
column9: we ignore it (i.e. we defer to linkify when we detect an overlapping span).  bug 4969832  change-id: ibd763ec297c4506aece2e9190d7c6fcf99e5454c

reshuffle month layout code  some changes to the code that renders cells on the tablet month view:  - font heights were computed with ascent only.  now descent is   included as well. - padding constants that implicitly included font descents have been   trimmed to compensate. - font metrics are rounded to the nearest integer rather than   truncated. - the "vertical space required" computation didn't match the rendering   code
column4: causing us to show one fewer event than we could in certain   cases (e.g. portrait view with 5+ events).  the layout itself hasn't changed at all -- what we draw now is a pixel-for-pixel match with what we had previously.  relates to bug 5567167  change-id: i98c80e8454a68a418422ddd3153bddeddabf29f0

Commit Message: change tablet month view event layout  two changes to the way that events are presented in the tablet month view.  first
column4: we no longer show the times for each event (which appear on a second line
column5: roughly doubling the vertical space consumed) unless we can do so for all events on that day.  second
column6: all-day events now get a full-width rectangle to make them easily distinguishable from non-all-day events.  also
column7: the decision for whether to use framed vs. filled boxes is made based on whether the attendee status is invited
column8: rather than none (the former indicating an invitation you haven't responded to
column9: the latter indicating you created an event for yourself).  this brings the month view behavior in sync with the week view.  bug 5567167  change-id: i986b92acc38e70774fa33e2aaeb063878e31c9a3

correct getviewtypecount for calendar appwidget  this was incorreclty returning 4 when there are 5 possible view types:     r.layout.appwidget_loading     r.layout.appwidget_no_events     r.layout.appwidget_day     r.layout.widget_all_day_item     r.layout.widget_item  in the right (wrong?) circumstances
column4: the appwidget may use all 5 types and then at layout or when trying to scroll the launcher (not the widget) will get an fc along the lines of:  java.lang.arrayindexoutofboundsexception: length=5; index=5     at android.widget.abslistview$recyclebin.addscrapview(abslistview.java:5970)     ...     at com.android.launcher2.launcherappwidgethostview.onlayout(src:87)  returning the correct value for getviewtypecount eliminates this launcher fc.  change-id: iaefeff7638d27457a2b3e366c40651d5d730dd5a

column5: "bob's shrimp") was created. page("bob's shrimp" was deleted.   --> redirect('shrimp') deleted via cascade. redirect('shrimp'
column6: "some other page") was created. page("some other page") deleted   --> redirect('shrimp'
column7: "some other page") deleted via cascade  attempting to revert the deleted "bob's shrimp" page would result in an error because we'd try and bring back the most recent redirect

column9: deleted page.  this change checks to see that
column11: the deleted references were actually deleted during the correct delete cascade-- not just /any/ delete cascade.

rename top-level `sapling` to `localwiki`.  this fixes some nasty (and hard to figure out) issues with django 1.4's new directory structure that were caused by having a `sapling` module inside of a `sapling` module.  this is just easier to reason about.  todo: explore renaming the inner `sapling` module to `core` or `main`.       likely not worth it right now as we're using the word sapling       all over.

Commit Message: rename 'sapling' app to 'main'.  testing out to see if this fixes an issue i'm having with deployment.  right now
column4: installs have various localwiki-0.x.x-py2.6.egg modules installed
column5: which all have a 'sapling' module inside.  'import sapling' causes this sapling module to be imported
column6: rather than the new 'main' sapling module for 1.4. by renaming 'sapling' to 'main' i hope to fix this and bring about a little more sanity to the project layout.
